conclusion: Using the principle of equilibrium in the current balance to find magnetic induction intensity B.
Magnetic force on the coil is F = nBIL, balanced by gravitational force initially.
Reversing the current reverses the direction of the magnetic force.
Additional mass m is added to balance the system after current reversal.
Magnetic force when current is reversed is F' = nBIL in opposite direction.
Additional weight mg is needed to balance reversed magnetic force.
Additional weight mg balances doubled magnetic force: mg = 2nBIL.
Rearrange equation to solve for B: B = mg / (2nIL).
